title.narrative: Government entities have strengthened capacity to improve the system for quality, equitable and inclusive education including the development of social and emotional skills (Adolescents)

description.narrative: There are existing efforts by government in improving access and quality of the provision of flexible learning opportunities among vulnerable adolescents. However, especially in view of the K-12 reforms, the education sector has a massive undertaking ahead, as can be seen from the recently endorsed Alternative Learning Systems 2.0 Roadmap. UNICEF strategically contributes to these efforts by supporting evidence generation in understanding barriers to access and learning among vulnerable adolescents as well as by providing ground-level reference models on strengthening quality social and emotional learning among adolescents, to inform policy and programme innovations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of teachers trained to provide distance support to learners with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
Existence of draft policy framework on strengthening quality social and emotional learning for adolescents

target.value: 2023:At least 4 Policy dialogues conducted and draft policy paper finalized

actual.value: 2019:Enhanced delivery of 21st century skills in ALS program – A total of 180 locally developed, contextualized activity-based worksheets are being used in Zamboanga del Norte by a total of 2,713 adolescent ALS learners aged 16-19.
